intro: Pilosella binata, commonly known as the two-branched hawkweed, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, disturbed habitats such as meadows and roadsides. Its leaves are hairy and alternate, while the flowers are yellow with a central disk. Pilosella binata is often found in temperate climates and is relatively easy to cultivate in gardens.
